newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - W.R. Grace rises.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - W.R. Grace rises.

text.p: Shares of W.R. Grace & Co rose in pre-opening trade Friday after the company said it would sell its packaging unit to Sealed Air Corp in a $5 billion deal.
Grace shares were trading at 69-1/2 from a close of 68-4/16, traders said. Grace had been at least as high as 71-1/2 in earlier trade.

The packaging and chemicals company said after the markets' close Thursday that it would sell its packaging business to Sealed Air and create a new publicly traded company. The deal is expected to be completed in early 1998.
Among other active shares, Gillette Co fell to 86-1/2 from a close of 90-3/16. A trader said the fall was caused by an article in Smart Money Magazine that was negative about the company.
Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp was trading at 33-5/8 from a close of 31-5/16 after The Wall Street Journal reported HealthSouth Corp had offered to buy large pieces of the company.
Bay Networks Inc eased to 32-5/16 from 32-15/16.
